title: that the establishment of a statutory fact-finding process to identify systemic
heading: 1. This Instrument may be cited as the Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act
text_raw:
1. This Instrument may be cited as the Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act 

1921 (Appointment of Tribunal) Instrument 2024.
text_norm: 1 instrument may cited tribunal inquiry (evidence) act 1921 (appointment tribunal) instrument 2024

title: that the establishment of a statutory fact-finding process to identify systemic
heading: 2. A tribunal (hereinafter called the “Tribunal”) is appointed to inquire into,
text_raw:
2. A tribunal (hereinafter called the “Tribunal”) is appointed to inquire into, 
report and make such findings and recommendations as it sees fit to the 
Taoiseach on the definite matters of urgent public importance specified in the 
resolution passed by Dáil Éireann on 24th January 2024 and by Seanad Éireann 
on 30th January 2024, the text of which resolutions is set out in the recital to this 
Instrument.
text_norm: 2 tribunal (hereinafter called tribunal ) appointed inquire report make finding recommendation see fit taoiseach definite matter urgent public importance specified resolution passed dail eireann 24th january 2024 seanad eireann 30th january 2024 text resolution set recital instrument

title: that the establishment of a statutory fact-finding process to identify systemic
heading: 3. The Honourable Judge Ann Power, a judge of the Court of Appeal, is
text_raw:
3. The Honourable Judge Ann Power, a judge of the Court of Appeal, is 

appointed to be the sole member of the Tribunal.
text_norm: 3 honourable judge ann power judge court appeal appointed sole member tribunal

title: that the establishment of a statutory fact-finding process to identify systemic
heading: 4. The Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act 1921 shall apply to the Tribunal.
text_raw:
4. The Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act 1921 shall apply to the Tribunal. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 June, 2024. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 
Minister of Defence.
